parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Settings for the new key pair.

responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.summary: Retrieve details of a key pair.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the key pair to retrieve.

operations.notes: If the request is successful, the response body is empty. If the request fails, an ApiResult is returned with details of the error.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the key pair to delete.

responseMessages.message: Resource is in use and cannot be deleted.

operations.summary: Generate a new certificate signing request (CSR) for this key pair.
operations.notes: For a successful request, the PEM-encoded CSR file is directly returned as text and the response content type is application/pkcs10. If an error occurs, an ApiResult is returned in JSON format, and the content type is application/json.

operations.summary: Import a CSR response for this key pair.

responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.summary: Download the key pair in PKCS12 format.
operations.notes: For a successful request, the PKCS12 file is directly returned in binary format and the response content type is application/x-pkcs12. If an error occurs, an ApiResult is returned in JSON format and the content type is application/json. Due to the sensitivity of the password parameter, the method for this operation is POST rather than GET.

responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.summary: Download the certificate from a given key pair.
operations.notes: For a successful request, the PEM-encoded certificate file is directly returned as text and the response content type is application/x-x509-ca-cert. If an error occurs, an ApiResult is returned in JSON format and the content type is application/json.

operations.summary: Retrieve details of rotation settings for a key pair.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the key pair to retrieve its rotation settings.

operations.summary: Add rotation settings to a key pair

responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.summary: Delete rotation settings for a signing key pair.
operations.notes: If the request is successful, the response body is empty. If the request fails, an ApiResult is returned with details of the error.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the key pair's rotation settings to delete.

PKCS12File.description: Represents the contents of a PKCS12 file.

id.description: The persistent, unique ID for the certificate. It can be any combination of [a-z0-9._-]. This property is system-assigned if not specified.

fileData.description: Base64 encoded PKCS12 file data. New line characters should be omitted or encoded in this value.

encryptedPassword.description: Encrypted password for the PKCS12 file.

cryptoProvider.description: Cryptographic Provider. This is only applicable if Hybrid HSM mode is true.

items.description: The actual list of KeyPairView instances.

id.description: The persistent, unique ID for the certificate.

serialNumber.description: The serial number assigned by the CA.

validFrom.description: The start date from which the item is valid, in ISO 8601 format (UTC).

expires.description: The end date up until which the item is valid, in ISO 8601 format (UTC).

version.description: The X.509 version to which the item conforms.

cryptoProvider.description: Cryptographic Provider. This is only applicable if Hybrid HSM mode is true.

rotationSettings.description: Key pair rotation settings. Only applicable to self-signed signing key pairs. Automatic key rotation is not currently available for SSL client or SSL server key pairs.

PKCS12ExportSettings.description: Settings for exporting a PKCS12 file from the system.

password.description: The password for the PKCS12 file that is created.

fieldPath.description: The path to the model field to which the error relates, if one exists.

creationBufferDays.description: Buffer days before key pair expiration for creation of a new key pair.

activationBufferDays.description: Buffer days before key pair expiration for activation of the new key pair.

validDays.description: Valid days for the new key pair to be created. If this property is unset, the validity days of the original key pair will be used.

keyAlgorithm.description: Key algorithm to be used while creating a new key pair. If this property is unset, the key algorithm of the original key pair will be used. Supported algorithms are available through the /keyPairs/keyAlgorithms endpoint.

keySize.description: Key size, in bits. If this property is unset, the key size of the original key pair will be used. Supported key sizes are available through the /keyPairs/keyAlgorithms endpoint.

signatureAlgorithm.description: Required if the original key pair used SHA1 algorithm. If this property is unset, the default signature algorithm of the original key pair will be used. Supported signature algorithms are available through the /keyPairs/keyAlgorithms endpoint.

ApiResult.description: Details on the result of the operation.

validationErrors.description: List of validation errors, if any.

fileData.description: The CSR response file data in PKCS7 format or as an X.509 certificate. PEM encoding (with or without the header and footer lines) is required. New line characters should be omitted or encoded in this value.

NewKeyPairSettings.description: Settings for creating a new key pair.

id.description: The persistent, unique ID for the certificate. It can be any combination of [a-z0-9._-]. This property is system-assigned if not specified.

commonName.description: Common name for key pair subject.

validDays.description: Number of days the key pair will be valid for.

keyAlgorithm.description: Key generation algorithm. Supported algorithms are available through the /keyPairs/keyAlgorithms endpoint.

keySize.description: Key size, in bits. If this property is unset, the default size for the key algorithm will be used. Supported key sizes are available through the /keyPairs/keyAlgorithms endpoint.

signatureAlgorithm.description: Signature algorithm. If this property is unset, the default signature algorithm for the key algorithm will be used. Supported signature algorithms are available through the /keyPairs/keyAlgorithms endpoint.

cryptoProvider.description: Cryptographic Provider.  This is only applicable if Hybrid HSM mode is true.
